title: About
text:
I’m a PhD Candidate in Health Services and Policy Research (Health Economics Track) at Boston University.
I study process changes made by health care delivery systems and payers to figure out what works and what doesn’t. I’m interested in insurance benefit design, low-value care, and health information technology. My time is split between supporting Veterans Health Administration operations (quality improvement, program evaluation) and my dissertation, which measures the effects of implementing a provider-facing, performance-based, tiered specialist network.

title: About
text:
Background

2023-Present, I’m a PhD intern with the Optum Center for Research and Innovation (OCRI) data science team.
2020-Present, I’m a data analyst supporting VHA operations with  PEPReC. 
2018-2020, I was a study coordinator with the  Division of General Internal Medicine  at Montefiore Einstein.
2014-2018, I was a senior research associate at  Statistics Collaborative Inc. 
2013-2014, I was testing software at  Epic .
2009-2013, I was an undergraduate at Kenyon College, studying biology and playing soccer.

  LinkedIn    Scholar
